diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Oligodendroglioma (World Health Organization grade II out of IV), with an elevated Ki-67 proliferation index, an IDH1 R132H mutation, and codeletion of 1p and 19q.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of oligodendroglioma was supported by MRI findings showing a nonenhancing, expansile lesion with characteristic histological features from biopsy, including infiltration of the surrounding white matter. Genetic testing confirmed the IDH1 mutation and 1p/19q codeletion, which align with the clinical diagnosis of oligodendroglioma.
